details-fields.name: host
details-fields.helper-text: Your databases IP address (e.g. 98.137.149.56) or its domain name (e.g. esc.mydatabase.com).

details-fields.name: schema-filters-patterns
details-fields.description: Comma separated names of schemas that should appear in Metabase
details-fields.helper-text: You can use patterns like "auth*" to match multiple schemas

details-fields.name: schema-filters-patterns
details-fields.description: Comma separated names of schemas that should NOT appear in Metabase
details-fields.helper-text: You can use patterns like "auth*" to match multiple schemas

details-fields.name: tunnel-host
details-fields.helper-text: The hostname that you use to connect to SSH tunnels.

details-fields.name: tunnel-user
details-fields.helper-text: The username you use to login to your SSH tunnel.

details-fields.name: tunnel-private-key
details-fields.display-name: SSH private key to connect to the tunnel
details-fields.placeholder: Paste the contents of an SSH private key here

details-fields.name: json-unfolding
details-fields.description: We unfold JSON columns into component fields.This is on by default but you can turn it off if performance is slow.

details-fields.name: auto_run_queries
details-fields.description: We execute the underlying query when you explore data using Summarize or Filter. This is on by default but you can turn it off if performance is slow.

details-fields.name: let-user-control-scheduling
details-fields.display-name: Choose when syncs and scans happen
details-fields.description: By default, Metabase does a lightweight hourly sync and an intensive daily scan of field values. If you have a large database, turn this on to make changes.

details-fields.name: schedules.metadata_sync
details-fields.description: This is a lightweight process that checks for updates to this database’s schema. In most cases, you should be fine leaving this set to sync hourly.

details-fields.name: schedules.cache_field_values
details-fields.description: Metabase can scan the values present in each field in this database to enable checkbox filters in dashboards and questions. This can be a somewhat resource-intensive process, particularly if you have a very large database. When should Metabase automatically scan and cache field values?

details-fields.name: refingerprint
details-fields.description: This enables Metabase to scan for additional field values during syncs allowing smarter behavior, like improved auto-binning on your bar charts.

details-fields.name: account-id
details-fields.helper-text: You can find the Account ID in Google Analytics → Admin → Account Settings.

details-fields.name: service-account-json
details-fields.helper-text: This JSON file contains the credentials Metabase needs to read and query your dataset.
